intro: Spatholobus, commonly known as the broad-leaved wattle, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow to orange flowers. The plant is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Spatholobus species are valued for their ornamental value and are sometimes used in ecological restoration projects. The genus includes several species, with Spatholobus suberosus being one of the most widely cultivated.
